intro: Phlomoides breviflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale blue or purple flowers in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and low-maintenance addition to gardens in suitable climates.
